Detailed Description

Encapsulates a bond length

void InternalCoordinate::addDegenerateCoordinate ( boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate >  coord  )  [inherited]

Links this coordinate to a degenerate internal coordinate. This method currently performs no sanity checks on whether these coordinates are actually degenerate.

Parameters:
coord The equivalent coordinate

static VectorPtr gigide::InternalCoordinate::addDelocalizedInternalCoordinates ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule >  mol,
std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr< SimpleInternalCoordinate > > &  simples,
std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate > > &  coords,
double  tol = 1e-8 
) [static, inherited]

Static method for constructing delocalized internal coordinates from a set of simple internal coordinates.

Parameters:
mol The molecule the coordinates are based on
simples A vector of simple internal coordinates to use in constructing delocalized internals
coords A vector of coordinates. The delocalized internals will be appened to this vector upon return.
tol The tolerance for throwing out small eigenvalues. Barring machine precision issues, the matrix should be positive definite.
Returns:
The eigenvalues of the B*B^T matrix

void InternalCoordinate::addEquivalentCoordinate ( boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate >  coord  )  [inherited]

Links this coordinate to an equivalent internal coordinate. This method currently performs no sanity checks on whether these coordinates are actually equivalent.

Parameters:
coord The equivalent coordinate

double InternalCoordinate::canonicalizeValue ( double  val  )  [virtual, inherited]

For torsion angles, etc, that are periodic, we need a way of canonicalizng the values to recognize that 2 and 0 are the same, for example. By default, for things like regular angles, bonds, linx, we just send back the original value.

Parameters:
val The value to canonicalize
Returns:
The canonicalized value, adjusted to meet a given choice of periodicity

Reimplemented in gigide::PeriodicCoordinate.

VectorPtr InternalCoordinate::characters (  )  [inherited]

Returns the characters of the coordinates with symm ops ordered as in Cotton, 3rd ed for default Abelian groups. For non-abelian, order is given by user input.

Returns:
The vector of characters for the internal coordinate

boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule >  mol 
) [static, inherited]

Static method for checking the numer of nonredundant internal coordinates, i.e. the completeness of the chosen set. This method will print a status summary to stdout.

Parameters:
coords The set of internal coordinates to check completness of
mol The molecule the coordinates are based on

virtual void gigide::SimpleInternalCoordinate::dummies ( std::vector< int > &  dummy_list  )  [virtual, inherited]

Fetches the dummy atom numbers for this molecule. The dummy atom number is zero-based corresponding to the molecule numbering. By default, nothing is done.

Parameters:
dummy_list The vector to append dummy atom numbers to. Numbers are appended and no content is cleared from the vector.

Reimplemented in gigide::Lin1.

static RectMatrixPtr gigide::InternalCoordinate::formBMatrix ( std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate > > &  coords  )  [static, inherited]

boost::intrusive_ptr< Atom > SimpleInternalCoordinate::getAtom ( int  idx  )  [inherited]

Given a coordinate number relative to the coordinate, returns the corresponding atom. The numbering matches that of Wilson, Decius, and Cross. For example, in methane, the bond angle H2-C1-H5 would have coordinate specific numbering 1->H2, 2->C1, 3->H5.

Parameters:
idx The atom number in the coordinate
Returns:
The atom corresponding to the number

RectMatrixPtr InternalCoordinate::getBMatrix (  )  [inherited]

Returns the B matrix associated with the molecule

Returns:
A matrix with rows corresponding to atoms and columns corresponding to the x,y,z disps of their B std::vectors.

VectorPtr InternalCoordinate::getBVector ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Atom >  atom  )  [inherited]

Returns the B std::vector associated with an individual atom

Parameters:
A RefPtr to an atom
Returns:
The B std::vector for the internal coordinate associated with that atom

VectorPtr InternalCoordinate::getBVectorAllAtoms ( void   )  [inherited]

Returns the B matrix associated with the molecule

Returns:
A std::vector representation of getBMatrix(). The x,y,z disps are now concatened to a give a std::vector of size 3N as opposed to an Nx3 matrix.

Get a "human readable" value for the internal coordinate. This returns angstrom for lengths and degrees for angles.

Returns:
Value of internal coordinate in conventional units

double InternalCoordinate::getUnitVectorDerivative ( int  n,
int  coord,
double  disp 
) [protected, inherited]

Returns the derivative of the coordinate with respect to coordinate displacement. This is done by numerical differentiation. This is typically use for validating complicated analytical formulas

Parameters:
n The number of the atom to displace in the derivative
coord The coordinate number (x=0,y=1,z=2) to displace
disp The size of the coordinate displacement. This should be chosen to maximize accuracy by balancing machine precision and small displacement size.
Returns:
The numerical B vector derivative

double BondLength::getValue (  )  [virtual]

Get the value of the coordinate at the current molecular geometry. In bohr/angstrom or radian depending on the coordinate.

Returns:
Internal coordinate value

Implements gigide::InternalCoordinate.

double SimpleInternalCoordinate::getValueForMolecule ( boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule >  mol  )  [virtual, inherited]

Assuming molecules are equivalent except for geometries being displaced, computes a value for this internal coordinate based on a different molecule. The underlying mol_ is not changed upon exit. This currently does not do any sanity checks to make the molecules are equivalent.

Parameters:
mol The new molecule to get the value for
Returns:
The value of the internal coordinate in the other molecule

Implements gigide::InternalCoordinate.

int Countable::incref (  )  [inherited]

void InternalCoordinate::init (  )  [protected, inherited]

The initialize function computes the B matrix at the given molecular geometry and computes the characters of the coordinate

bool InternalCoordinate::isEquivalent ( boost::intrusive_ptr< InternalCoordinate >  coord,
double  tol = 1e-8 
) [inherited]

Test equivalence of internal coordinates. This loops through all the symmetry elements of the molecule and does a numeric check to see if the one of the B vectors gets mapped onto the other

Parameters:
coord The internal coordinate to test equivalence to
tol The tolerance for declaring two B vectors equivalent
Returns:
Whether the coordinates are equivalent

bool InternalCoordinate::isValidValue ( double  val  )  [virtual, inherited]

Determines whether a value is valid. Used for sanity checks on things like torsions and angles which have well-defined ranges. By default, the value is assumed valid unless overwritten.

Parameters:
val The value to check
Returns:
Whether the value is valid

Reimplemented in gigide::BondAngle, and gigide::OutOfPlaneBend.

Returns:

boost::intrusive_ptr< Molecule > InternalCoordinate::mol (  )  [inherited]

Accessor method for the molecule the coordinate is based on

Returns:
The molecule for this coordinate

int SimpleInternalCoordinate::mol_number ( int  num  )  [protected, inherited]

Given the coordinate specific numbering, returns the atom number in the molecule. For example, in methane, the bond angle H2-C1-H5 would have coordinate specific numbering 1->H2, 2->C1, 3->H5 so mol_number would map 1->2, 2-1, 3->5.

Parameters:
num The coordinate specific number
Returns:
The atom number in the molecule

void gigide::InternalCoordinate::printEquivalentCoordinates ( std::ostream &  os = std::cout  )  [inherited]

Print the set of equivalent coordinates linked to this internal coordinate

Parameters:
os The output stream to print to (e.g. cout, stringstream, cerr)

void BondLength::recompute (  )  [virtual]

Recomputes the B vector for the coordinate. This is typically called after changing the molecular coordinates. No "extended" recompute is done for symmetry internal coordinates. If the underlying simples are not recomputed, the symmetry internal coordinate will simply recompute to the exact same value.

Implements gigide::InternalCoordinate.

void InternalCoordinate::testBVectors ( double  tol = 1e-10  )  [inherited]

Debug method for validating analytic formulas for new coordinates. This computes B vector derivatives through numerical differentation and compares to the analytic result. Aborts on failed test.

Parameters:
tol The tolerance for numeric and analytic results being equal

string InternalCoordinate::type (  )  [inherited]

Returns a description of the coordinate.
STRE bond length
BEND bond angle
OUT out of plane bend
TORS torsion
LINX x linear bend
LINY y line bend
LIN1 fixed vector linear bend
SYMM symmetry internal coordinate

Returns:
The coordinate type

Member Data Documentation

std::map<int, boost::intrusive_ptr<Atom> > gigide::SimpleInternalCoordinate::atom_map_ [protected, inherited]

Maps coordinate specific numbering to atom object. See getAtom.

RectMatrixPtr gigide::InternalCoordinate::bmatrix_ [protected, inherited]

The B matrix associated with the internal coordinate. This is NOT the complete B matrix as given in Wilson, Decius, and Cross. Rows of bmatrix_ are the atoms and the columns are the x,y, and z components of the B vectors. In particular, the matrix is given by

where is the internal coordinate value and is the the th coordinate of the th atom.

VectorPtr gigide::InternalCoordinate::characters_ [protected, inherited]

A std::vector giving the characters of the coordinate under the various symmetry operations of the molecule. The symmetry operations are ordered as in Cotton, 3rd ed for default Abelian symmetry. For non-Abelian, the user inputs the order in the input file.

std::vector<int> gigide::SimpleInternalCoordinate::connectivity_ [protected, inherited]

In methane, the bond angle H2-C1-H5 would have coordinate specific numbering 1->H2, 2->C1, 3->H5 so connectivity vector would be <2,1,5>.

std::string gigide::InternalCoordinate::coordtype_ [protected, inherited]

A descriptive std::string for the type of coordinate. See type()

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<InternalCoordinate> > gigide::InternalCoordinate::degencoords_ [protected, inherited]

A vector containing degenerate internal coordinates. For example, if this coordinate were a E irrep stretch in methane, this vector would hold a reference to the other two E irrep bond stretches.

std::vector< boost::intrusive_ptr<InternalCoordinate> > gigide::InternalCoordinate::equivcoords_ [protected, inherited]

A vector containing equivalent internal coordinates. For example, if this coordinate were a bond stretch in water, this vector would hold a reference to the other bond stretch.

boost::intrusive_ptr<Molecule> gigide::InternalCoordinate::mol_ [protected, inherited]

Each internal coordinate must be linked to a specific molecule
